title: Prime Minister of Spain - Wikipedia
snippet: Since 2004, the retired prime ministers are eligible for a seat in the Council of State for life. As of 2025, only Jose María Aznar (2005–2006) and José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero (2011–2015) used this privilege.

title: Pedro Sánchez - Wikipedia
snippet: Pedro Sánchez Pérez-Castejón (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈpeðɾo ˈsantʃeθ ˈpeɾeθ kasteˈxon] ⓘ; born 29 February 1972) is a Spanish politician and economist who has served as Prime Minister of Spain since 2018.

title: Unraveling the Mystery: Does Spain Have a Prime Minister?
snippet: Yes, Spain has a Prime Minister, currently Pedro Sánchez, who leads the government under a parliamentary system.

title: Pedro Sanchez - BBC News
snippet: 19 Jun 2025 · 12 Jun 2025 · Pedro Sánchez faces mounting pressure after an escalating corruption scandal brought down a senior colleague. 12 Jun 2025 · 19 May 2025 · Pedro Sánchez warns against "double standards" after Russia was banned from the song contest in 2022.

title: List of prime ministers of Spain - Wikipedia
snippet: In contemporary Spain, the first prime minister of the Kingdom of Spain since the approval of the Constitution of 1978 was Adolfo Suárez. Due to the gradual evolution of the post, the title has been applied to early prime ministers retroactively.
